Bulgarian jailers protest nationwide
Hundreds of prison workers from all over Bulgaria organized a nationwide protest in front of the Ministry of Justice in the capital Sofia.
In the peaceful demonstration, they repeated their demands for the restoration of their old working conditions, which have recently been changed.
Higher salaries are also on a list of claims to be discussed with Interim Minister of Justice Hristo Ivanov.
The officials have been symbolically protesting for a month against the new working hours and calling for a return to the previous 24-hour shifts.
Despite meetings between the union of prison workers and representatives of the Ministry of Justice, no agreement was reached, reported the Bulgarian National Ratio (BNR).
The negotiations continue, the Director General for the implementation of sanctions told the BNR, Rosen Zhelyazkov.
The protest of the prison workers is expected to be supported by members of the union association of employees of the Ministry of the Interior.
Ukrainian Army has abandoned Luhansk airport
In eastern Ukraine the pro-Russian fighters are on the rise.
After heavy battles, which allegedly also involved Russian tank battalions, the Ukrainian army today, Monday, abandoned the airport of the rebel stronghold Luhansk.
The army also announced that seven soldiers had been killed in the past 24 hours.

Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko had previously drawn human consequences from the severe defeats of his army in the fight against the separatists and announced changes in the top army leadership without mentioning details.
Pro-Russian separatists fired aircraft
In the fight against Ukrainian government troops, pro-Russian separatists shot down another fighter aircraft and two military helicopters.
In addition, some 100 soldiers were injured or killed in battles in the Donetsk region, according to Russian agencies on Monday.
Coast Guard ships sunk
The insurgents also claimed to have sunk two boats of the Ukrainian coast guard for the first time in the Azov Sea.
The Ukrainian border guard confirmed that two of his ships had been bombed on Sunday near the port of Mariupol.
Seven border guards were injured, said a spokesman in Kiev, 112.ua.
Two crew members were considered missing.
Local media blamed Russia for the incident.
The separatists also reported that they had brought several villages in the Donetsk area under their control.
Diplomatic offensive in Minsk
Today the Ukraine Contact Group meets in the Belarusian capital Minsk.
In addition to representatives of Ukraine, Russia and the OSCE, an ambassador of the separatists from eastern Ukraine should also participate.
In the run-up, all actors used their appearances to publicise their demands.
NATO does not want to break agreements with Russia
NATO will not break its agreement with Russia due to the planned deployments in Eastern Europe as a result of the Ukraine crisis.
NATO Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen said on Monday in Brussels that NATO adheres to the 1997 founding agreement of the NATO-Russia Council.
The NATO boss, however, accused Russia of "a gross breach" of the agreement.
"Today we have to face the reality that Russia does not regard NATO as a partner," says Rasmussen.
From documents and statements from the Russian side it emerges that "they regard us as opponents".
Stronger NATO presence
Rasmussen has also announced its intention to strengthen NATO's presence in Eastern Europe.

A "Readiness Action Plan" to be adopted at the NATO summit in Wales will ensure that "we will have more visible NATO presence in the East as long as this is necessary," Rasmussen said on Monday in Brussels.
Kiev and Moscow agree on new gas talks
Russia and Ukraine have officially agreed on new talks to resolve their gas dispute.
The negotiations are scheduled for next Saturday, said Russian energy minister Alexander Nowak on Monday.
A decision by the European Union to send a representative to the talks was still awaited.
Because of the dispute over the gas price, Ukraine has not received fuel from Russia for weeks.
Most recently, EU Energy Commissioner Günther Oettinger had mediated between both sides.
Ukraine had warned that Russia could also interrupt the gas supply for Europe.
Europe receives about one third of its natural gas from Russian sources, of which a large part flows through Ukraine.

Genetic disorder often misdiagnosed
A British woman says she thought, as a result of a misdiagnosis over many years, that she would die.
Karin Rodgers lived almost all her youth in the belief that she had only a few years to live after being diagnosed with another disease.
She actually suffered from Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT) - a group of inherited disorders that damage the nerves outside the brain and spinal cord.
Charity CMT UK reported that misdiagnoses are a common problem in people with CMT because so little is known about this disease.
About 23,000 people in the UK are likely to suffer from CMT, which can lead to motor disorders such as muscle weakness, insecure gait and curved toes.
Patients also suffer from numbness or pain. The disease is incurable and progressive, which means that the symptoms get worse over time.
When Rodgers was 13, she believed that she was suffering from Friedreich-Ataxia (FA) - a disease with very poor chances of survival.
Rodgers thought she was in a wheelchair before she was 18 and died before her 30th birthday.
The mother of two children, who is now 51 years old, said, "As a child, I knew I couldn't do the same thing as the others.
I fell down all the time and everything lasted longer with me.
I could never ride roller skate or skateboard with the other kids and was often teased at school because of my way of walking and running.

Rodgers said that at the age of 13 after several surgeries to relieve her Achilles tendons and stretch her feet, she saw her medical records when her doctor had left the room and read that she was suffering from FA.
"I felt guilty because I was curious, so I didn't tell anyone, but I went home, looked for the disease in the library, and wrote to the FA society," she said.
When I received an answer, I was shocked and panicked.
I thought I'd be in a wheelchair when I was 18 and I'd die when I was 25, and in between I'd slowly lose all my abilities.
I did all this alone with myself and planned my own funeral.
She said that when she was 17, she realized that her skills had not decreased as much as she had imagined and questioned her doctor.
He just got up and hugged me and said, "My love, I don't think you have that, otherwise you'd be in a wheelchair right now."
I think you have something far less life-threatening.
After some genetic tests, her CMT was detected.
"When he explained to me what CMT was, I felt like I was a winner," she said.
Charity CMT UK has launched a CMT awareness month to raise awareness of this disease.
Stabsfeldwebel a. D. Berni Diether has been working as a fireworks worker since the closure of the former troop training area
For almost ten years, the former military training ground in Münsingen has not been used.
Still, killing ammunition appears every month at the heart of the Swabian Alb biosphere region.
The grenades are sometimes so dangerous that they have to be blown up on the ground.
A deafening bang echoes over the heart of the biosphere area during the blasts.
In December 2004, the last sharp shot was fired at the Münsingen training ground, which was closed at the end of 2005 after 110 years of military operation.
Since that time, the 6500-hectare area has been the core of the Swabian Alb biosphere area, which is open to hikers and cyclists on 13 designated paths.
Tax burden on businessmen in the Washington area increases with economic recovery
A recovery in the economy means more customers, more sales and new jobs.
It also means higher taxes.

State and local tax rulings for companies in the country increased slightly last year, while the economic recovery accelerated, according to a newly published study last week, and the companies in the Washington area were no exception.

Companies in the District area, Maryland and Virginia jointly paid $27.7 billion to government and local authorities in the 2013 financial year, an increase of 3.8 percent compared to revenues of $26.6 billion in 2012.

The company's state and local tax burden increased by 4.3 percent last year to $671 billion, compared to 3.9 percent in the previous year, and it was the third consecutive year of growth after several years of falling decisions in 2009 and 2010.
State taxes increased more than local taxes, by 4.3 percent, according to the study carried out by the service agency Ernst & Young with the Centre for State Taxation, a tax policy group.
More than half of the district's tax revenue, 56 percent, comes from corporate taxes, while 36 percent of Maryland's revenue comes from companies.
Virginia generates the lowest tax revenue from companies at 28 percent.

Much of the increase in tax revenues is due to a recovery in the property values of companies, the researchers say, resulting in an increase in property taxes of 3.7 percent this year after the three consecutive years with growth rates of less than 1 percent.
While a large part of these profits came from large states such as California, New York and Texas, the process seems to be also true for the Washington area.
Companies in the District, Maryland and Virginia jointly paid over $10 billion in state and local property taxes last year, compared to $9.6 billion in 2012 - an increase of 4.2 percent over a year.

But the apparent recovery in real estate values is not so effective in increasing state and local tax revenues in Maryland, as here real estate taxes amount to just over a fifth of corporate tax rulings.
Companies in Virginia and D.C. pay almost half of their state and local taxes in the form of real estate taxes.

"In Maryland, the following happens: a large part of the real estate, especially in the tax area around D.C., is owned either by the government or non-profit organizations that do not pay real estate taxes," said Douglas Lindholm, CEO of the Center on State Taxation.
Maryland is therefore forced, for example, to rely much more on income taxes to provide the same services that other states offer.
The recent recovery in corporate tax revenues cannot be attributed solely to the recovery of the real estate market
Business revenues also appear to be recovering, according to the data.
Companies in the region reported income taxes to government organizations of $2.3 billion compared to 2.1 billion in 2012.
Maryland took $1 billion in corporate income taxes, the highest amount in the region.
While the trend is moving in the same direction, the local tax burden on companies does not rise evenly in all three places.
The increase in the district was 4.3 percent in line with the national average, while the increase in Maryland was significantly higher, 4.9 percent.
Only Virginia reported below-average tax revenue of 4.1 percent.
Virginia has the lowest corporate income taxes (in all three there are fixed corporate tax rates) with 6 percent in all three official areas.
The corporate tax rate in Maryland is 8.25% and the district is relatively high 9.975 percent.

A comparable study by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce at the beginning of this year showed that lower state and local corporate taxes are required in Virginia and that overall there is a better tax climate than in Maryland.
The study did not investigate the district.
Despite the benefits, Virginia is under pressure from its southern neighbor.
North Carolina has passed laws to lower its corporate tax rates this year from 6.9 percent to 6 percent, the same rate as Virginia, and the rate will fall to 5 percent next year.
If the state continues to meet its income targets in the coming year, this law could reduce the state's corporate income tax rate to 3 percent by 2017.
In the meantime, small businesses in the Washington area seem to be doing better, so they pay more state and local taxes, according to the latest study.

Corporate taxes paid as personal income taxes by small businessmen - a transitional structure according to which most small businesses are organized - in the District, Maryland and Virginia increased by 20 percent last year to $2.4 billion, a significantly faster growth rate than corporate taxes as a whole.

The researchers say that the trend and increase in corporate taxes across the country will probably continue this year, with an increase of 6.2 percent in general tax revenues for the state and local governments in the first three quarters of 2014 compared to the same period of the previous year.
Nevertheless, the Washington area could lag behind if the federal government's spending cuts had an impact on the labour market in the region.
Partner city: German beer for Guangzhou
Hops and malt - also a popular combination in China.
German beer enjoys an excellent reputation in China.
Frankfurt's partner city in China now wishes for a brewery and also hopes for a direct flight connection between the two cities.
German beer, brewed in Frankfurt's partner city Guangzhou - this is the urgent wish of the officials in China.
"We would be very pleased if a German brewery would settle in our city," said Li Yiwei, vice-party secretary of the southern Chinese metropolis, this week visiting a SPD delegation in his city.
Time and again, during the conversation, the functionary of the ruling Chinese Communist Party returned to this concern of the twelve million metropolis.
Guangzhou, also known as the canton of Germany, is one of the richest cities in China, and it was the largest city in China.
Therefore, people also had the purchasing power to afford German beer.
Hessian SPD chairman Thorsten Schäfer-Gümbel, who led the German political delegation, told the host that he would look around for a possible partner for the project in Germany.
"For beer, it doesn't take much: good water, grain and joie de vivre," he added at lunch with the party leader in Guangzhou.
This joy of life already radiated Mr. Li, he flattered the host.
As a result, the functionary from Guangzhou started with Schäfer-Gümbel - but with red wine, which was served to the food.
The Chinese brand Tsingtao goes back to German brewing.
Tsingtao beer is brewed according to the German purity law.
More business
A second wish of the Chinese hosts would be a direct flight between Frankfurt and Guangzhou, said Vice Party leader Li.
Lufthansa had previously offered the flight, but was canceled in 2012 for economic reasons.
"It would be worthwhile again," the local politician was convinced.
"Business between our two cities continues to increase."
At the moment, travelers would have to take the detour via Changsha in Hunan Province, Li complained.
The Guangdong Province administration, whose capital is Guangzhou, is also hoping for a flight connection.
The vice-governor of the province, Chen Yunxian, highlighted this wish in his conversation with the Social Democrats.
"This is a very good idea," answered Schäfer-Gümbel - the Chinese vice minister Li Jinjun, an intimate expert in Germany, nodded in agreement.
Well-kept partnership
The beatified vice-party leader of Guangzhou hopes that he will be able to visit Frankfurt next year for a partnership meeting.
Li Yiwei was already on the Main, but not yet in this function.
He only came into office this year after his predecessor had been promoted from office for corruption charges.
Local party leader Wan Qinglian also had to leave.
The action against Guangzhou officials is part of a nationwide campaign against corruption in the party and administration, which is harshly enforced by head of state Xi Jinping.
The new leader Li Yiwei had worked for an American company before his party career, which is highly unusual in the Chinese Communist Party.
Before taking office in Guangzhou, he worked as a top functionary in Fujian, where VW built a large factory.
Frankfurt has officially entered into more than a dozen town partnerships.
The connection to Guangzhou, 9000 kilometers away, is one of those maintained by both sides, for example with a student exchange.
Last year, the 25th anniversary of the German-Chinese Association was celebrated.
The South China metropolis on the Pearl River is almost as strong with its economic power as all of Hesse.
Next year, it aims to achieve a gross domestic product of 250 billion euros, Li reported.

Eco-friendly vacuum cleaners and rising wages
More stringent environmental standards will apply to cars and vacuum cleaners that are on the market from today.

Similar to refrigerators and washing machines, new vacuum cleaners will receive a label from 1 September, on which the buyer will be able to recognise central data such as the energy efficiency of the device at a glance.
For new cars there are sharper nitrogen oxide values in the pollutant class "Euro 6".
In addition, there is more money for scaffolders: they receive a nationwide uniform minimum wage of 10.25 euros.
Amazon buys Twitch for $1.04 billion

AMAZON just confirmed what information had reported on Monday morning: The online retailer - and video producer, and a variety of other things - buys the video streaming service Twitch for $1.04 billion (970 million US-$).
The announcement comes as a surprise, not because no one had expected a takeover of Twitch, but because it was widely suspected that YouTube would acquire the company.
Three months ago, it looked like the sale of Twitch to Google's video service was for a cool billion decided thing, and the collaboration also appeared natural.
Twitch, which was founded only three years ago as Justin.tv, was launched as a general streaming service - a live version of YouTube.
Instead, it quickly became a platform for players who wanted to publish their bravo pieces in games, a "YouTube for live games," says an insider.
The Twitch interface.
And "let's play", a video genre in which better-knowers give the (mostly older) games a painting of secret science theatre, are already very popular on YouTube.

It's just that YouTube is often called when you want to describe Twitch, so the news that YouTube wanted to buy Twitch was a bit bored, a textbook example of an established technology company buying a potential competitor.
It's a mystery why the deal with YouTube didn't come about, as the company reportedly was willing to pay as much as Amazon did.

All we know about this right now is this statement by Emmet Shear, President of Twitch: "We chose Amazon because they believe in our community, they share our values and long-term visions, and they want to help us get there faster."
Another secret is, frankly, the incredible success of Twitch.

For snobs like me, who explain that they prefer to play sports rather than watch, it's hard to understand the attraction that comes from watching others play, rather than taking control console into their own hands.

It's one thing to look over a friend's shoulder at 3:00 a.m. while she's sneaking through Resident Evil, and something completely different, watching a freak shoot him in the head 20 times in Call of Duty.
All these games you could watch right now.
Another problem is that many of the most popular games today are ego games, so watching can be a really good recipe for headaches without your own control over the perspective.
I admit that the fast runs in which the Roger Bannisters of our electronic age complete whole games in record time are entertaining.
But as long as there isn't a game or humor virtuoso, his Twitch channel is probably not so interesting.
But what do skeptics like me know about this?
Twitch is called up by 55 million different visitors per month and is the fourth largest source of Internet traffic peaks.
And how exactly does Amazon want to make money out of it?
It's hard to imagine that Twitch is integrated as elegantly into Amazon Instant Video as YouTube Twitch could easily have swallowed.
But Twitch has something every company would like: thousands of young men who are advertised as advertisers.
As Twitch's chairman, Shear, said, Amazon and Twitch both "believe in the future of gaming," and the medium shows no signs of shrinking, not even - swallowing - as a spectator sport.

Clever ways to save on university textbooks
Since the cost of university textbooks for many students is more than $1,000 per year, the fast-second semester student Matt Schroeder thought of a clever spar idea.
He invented a loan system for books by students of higher semesters and offered a nominal compensation to delay the sale of the books.
"My math book usually costs $180, but I got it for $10 for a semester and a chick-fil-a-kek," said Schroeder, 19, who attends Covenant College in Georgia.
The books needed for the last semester cost him $430, he said.
He spent $120.
The college management reported that on average, students spend more than $1,200 a year on textbooks and study materials, but that there are different cost reduction options for students.
Online shops and creative approaches such as the Schroeders are increasingly the solution of choice for students.
The rent of textbooks is becoming more popular, and so students can use a book for a semester, often at a much lower price than when buying.
Neebo Inc, which operates more than 250 university bookstores, announced that the rental of textbooks has doubled since 2011.
Surveys in the industry show that about a quarter of the books were rented in the college bookstores last spring semester, said Neebo's Vice President Tevor Meyer.
Less than half of all textbooks are purchased in campus bookshops, according to the National Association of College Stores.
Here's the one-time deal for the best deals.
Buy online
Some new books cost online only a third of the price for which they are available in the campus bookstore.
The ninth edition of "Calculus" vno Ron Larwon, Bruce Edwards and Robert Hostetler costs nearly $ 290, but can be purchased from the specialized textbook retailer Chegg.com for $239.99.
Buy Used
If you don't mind the notes of other or normal signs of use, used books are a good option.
Calculus is used on Chegg.com for $93.49.

Matt Casaday, 25, graduate student at Brigham Young University, says he spent 42 cents on Amazon.com for a used edition of "Strategic Media Decisions: Understanding The Business End Of The Advertising Business."
The book was sold for $48.
Academics such as Ingrid Bracey, head of the University of Massachusetts at Amherst College Without Walls, recommended that students ask their professors if previous issues were allowed.
Sometimes the updates are not relevant for the seminar work.
In such cases, older expenditures can often be purchased for a fraction of the cost of the latest edition.
Besides Chegg and Amazon, Half.com from eBay Inc is also a popular alternative for used books.
Rents
Renting textbooks is worth considering if you treat them reasonably well, remember to return them and you don't want to keep the books after completing the course.
You can save more than 80 percent of the cost of a newly purchased book.
For example, a student could rent "Calculus" for a semester for about $20.
Find out about the terms of the business where you are renting, including the penalties that may apply to the writing of notes, underlinings or traces of use.
Tenants pay attention: If you do not return the book, the penalty fees may even exceed the price of a new book.
E-books
E-books instead of conventional textbooks are also an option.
Sometimes these books are de facto rented by providing an electronic license for a certain period of time by wholesalers such as Amazon.com, Chegg and Barnes & Noble Inc.
At Chegg you can rent "Calculus" for 6 months for about $61.
Bracey says that students often find the best offers in literature courses, as many classics can be downloaded for free nowadays, while scientific and engineering textbooks can be very expensive.
I'm sure you'll look around.
Joe Gault, 29, who will soon be attending Pepperdine Law School, recommends the ISBN number for pricing books, as you can be sure to find the right textbook.
And before ordering online, one should check, so Gault, whether the book is actually in stock.
He learned this lesson on the hard way.
He bought a book that had four weeks delivery time and eventually paid the full price in the college bookstore.
Why "Guardians of the Galaxy" didn't become a cashier

"The Expendables 3" by Sylvester Stallone played less than $30 million of its $90 million budget in the United States, while "Sin City: A Dame to Kill For" earned only $12 million of its $70 million budget.
The film "Sex Tape", tailored to Cameron Diaz, only received $14.6 million at the opening weekend, while children's films such as "Drachenzämmen leicht macht 2" also disappoint with their revenues.
An article by the telegraph film critic Robbie Collin suggests that the lack of quality in the films themselves could be the reason for the children's films.
Collin described 2014 as "the worst year" so far for children's films and described "Drachenzämmen leicht gemacht 2" as a purely "functional" fantasy sequel.
For films for a slightly older target group, however, it seems that the quality of the films is not necessarily the problem.

In July, Entertainment Weekly compared the average CinemaScore and Metacritic rating for each summer release, which was shown on at least 2000 screens between the American Memorial Day and 20 July 2013 and the current year.
The results are based on the opinion of cinemagoers and film critics and suggest that this year's film hits are equivalent to last year's.
Some commentators believe that the development is due to changing viewing habits and the growing popularity of web streaming services such as Netflix.
Director Jon Favreau, currently working on Disney's soon-to-be-release jungle book film, told Hollywood Reporter to the website, "I think times are changing."
We must accept this and not try to follow the past.

In contrast to the currently weak cash results of Hollywood productions, Netflix has recently generated revenue of $1.2 billion in streaming content, almost twice as much as last year's $837 million in revenue.
Last summer, director Steven Spielberg criticized the film studios for focusing too much on comic films and for prophesied a "melting of the core" of Hollywood.
In the light of the current downturn, some commentators argue that his gloomy prophecy could contain a true core.

However, due to the potential cashier hits expected in the summer of 2015, including Avengers: Age of Ultron, Minions and Jurassic World, other representatives of the film industry are more optimistic:

The producer of X-Men, Simon Kinberg, recently described the decline in cash results as simply "cyclic" and said to Hollywood reporter: "Next summer will be the biggest summer at the box office ever, and no one will worry about business anymore."

TWO young bushwalkers were brought to safety with the winch after they were caught the night in the Blue Mountains in NSW.
THE 16-year-old girl and the 19-year-old man left for their tour in Govett's Leap in Blackheath shortly after Sunday noon.
Concerned relatives called the police at about 8 p.m. when they had not returned home.
A search group of local police and rescue services left and the couple was found near the Bridal Veil waterfalls at about 11 p.m.
The girl had hurt her knee and the man had fallen and had his head open.
Rescue forces stayed with the couple overnight, and they were flown out on Monday morning.
They were sent to Blue Mountains Hospital in a stable condition with an ambulance.
escalate anti-government protests in Pakistan

After about half an hour, the station re-recorded the broadcast.
PTV director Athar Farooq said the sticks-equipped demonstrators had damaged equipment in the editorial office.
Dead or injured were not reported.
The demonstrators demand the resignation of the head of government, to whom they accuse election fraud.
The police said that about a kilometre from the residence of Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, there were again clashes with security forces on Monday by some 3,000 demonstrators.

They call for the resignation of the Prime Minister.

The communication further stated: "The army remains committed to its role of ensuring the security of the state".
The escalating violence has stirred up concern about military intervention, which has been more frequent in the past.
The protests led by opposition politician Imran Khan and preacher Tahirul Qadri have continued since Independence Day on 14 August.

Qadri expressed similar views.
Khan accuses Sharif of winning the parliamentary election in May last year by fraud.
Qadri calls for the resignation of the central and provincial governments.
Then a transitional government should reform the electoral system and announce new elections.
More than 40,000 security forces are deployed to protect the government district.
The demonstrators had initially peacefully endured in front of the parliament until Khan and Qadri called on them to advance to Sharif's residence this weekend.

Under this top, there's rest
We showed a powerful tribe in our mystery task of the summer series "Mein Stück vom Rhöner Glück" last Friday.
Several of these tree giants still exist in the district, the pictured specimen is the "Geißruheiche" above Unterweißenbrunn.
A bumpy footpath leads up to the 600-year-old oak.
It goes past Koppeln, Basaltsteinstäfte and Basaltsteinmeeren.
A bit below the quarry from Bauersberg, one kilometer north of the road to Weisbach, there it stands.
Vital looks like the natural monument, it protrudes beyond the other trees of the surrounding area and reminds of an American mammoth tree with a circumference of more than eight meters.
A small Buddha on a tree stump indicates that it is a spiritual or mystical place.
Despite intensive research, however, there were only indications of the origin of the name.
Dr. Wolfgang Schneider especially consulted the Bischofsheimer Archive and interviewed older people from Unterweißenbrunn to find out what their relationship with the Geißruheiche is.
The result of his research remained the rather sober explanation for the name.
Thus, until about 80 years ago, the goat shepherds were supposed to have driven their animals from Unterweißenbrunn to the toiled meadows freed from stones.
At the foot of the tree the animal guardians exhausted from the ascent are said to have rested.
In the meantime, the area has regained its importance, because in the meadows, herds of goats are actually grazing again.
The area has also been declared the core zone of the Biosphere Reserve, Schneider has further discovered.
However, when entering the stone collections, caution should be exercised, because the basalt heated by the sun is also a popular place for cruciform otters.
A hiking trail leads from Unterweißenbrunn to the tree, which is somewhat hidden.
Further paths are signposted, which climb up to Hochrhön and invite you to an extended hike.
Where's the water castle?
However, a water castle, which is sought in our next task, is rather rare in height.
The reflection in the ditch gives a good impression of the building, but we have some historical buildings in the district to which the building counterfei could fit.
Where is our piece of Rhöner Glück located?
My piece Rhöner Glück
As with previous Main-Post series in recent years, there are prizes to be won again this year if they have the right solution.
Those who like to photograph themselves can also participate.
At the e-mail address red.neustadt@mainpost.de you can send us the solution and also your very personal "piece of the Rhöner Glück" under this keyword.
The most beautiful photos will be published.

After weeks of tug-of-war, Italy's Prime Minister and current EU Chairman, Matteo Renzi, won the nomination of his Foreign Minister Federica Mogherini as head of EU foreign policy last week against strong conservative resistance at the EU's special summit, succeeding Catherine Ashton.

Renzi, as the pro-government daily La Repubblica reflects, considers the appointment of his Mogherini, who is also a favorite in the government team, to strengthen the position of the Social Democrats and his own in the EU.
He also expects a boost for his "reform package" in Italy.
Last but not least, Renzi hopes to put the left-wing party base, which is constantly protesting against him, in a calm way, because Mogherini is associated with it - albeit more moderately.

The conservative representatives with Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker and the Poland nominated as President of the Council, Donald Tusk, said that the prevailing opinion in Rome would make a political balance.
The EU's Chief Diplomat will be the deputy of Commission President Juncker at the same time.
The remaining agreement of the EU Parliament is considered to be safe.
Otherwise, President Giorgio Napolitano would hardly have called the nomination of the 41-year-old politician of the ruling Democratic Party (PD) an "important recognition" of Italy's role in the EU.

La Repubblica spreads optimism that the Mogherini, which has been proven in leading party offices for almost two decades and is known for its ambition, will be able to cope with the "enormous challenges".
The native Roman woman is married and has two daughters.

Her political career began in 1996 in the youth organization of the then Democratici di Sinistra (Left Democrats), which merged in 2008 with the Catholic centre party Margherita to form today's Social Democratic PD.
In 1999, Mogherini became Vice-President of the European Community Organisation of Socialist Youth for three years.
With the 2001 election to the Party Council of the Left Democrats, she joined the high party politics, worked in the foreign policy department, whose head she soon became.

It occupied traditional priorities of Italian foreign policy such as the Middle East, became known through studies on NATO's deployment in Afghanistan, in which Italy is involved with a contingent of troops, used contacts with the social democrats in Europe and with the democrats in the USA.
She has been a member of the Chamber of Deputies since 2008, where she is an expert in defence and European and international affairs.
When Renzi became Prime Minister in February 2014, he appointed Mogherini as Minister of Foreign Affairs.

If the PD again has a better relationship with the strong peace movement in the country, which contributed to the party's over 40 percent vote in the EU elections in May, then Federica Mogherini has a share in it, as noted in PD circles.
The accusations in Brussels that the new EU High Representative had too little diplomatic experience, so if it lacks substance, are countered in the PD.
In Brussels, particularly by Poland and the Baltic members, Mogherinis' suspiciously realistic accents on the crisis in Ukraine are being pursued and defamed as a "Russia-friendly course".

It supports the South Stream pipeline operated by the Russian company Gasprom, through which Russian gas is to be transported directly to Southern Europe by bypassing Ukraine, which also serves to secure Italy's energy.
Following Renzi's appointment as EU President in July, Mogherini travelled to Moscow for her first state visit.
Photos they showed with Putin at the shake-hands were taken in Brussels with indignation, as well as inviting the Kremlin leader to a Milan Economic Summit for October.
A total of nine young people started their training at emz-Hanauer in Nabburg on Monday.
Among them is an apprentice who has already completed another training in the company.
In the future, the new employees will work in four training occupations: electronics technicians (three trainees), mechatronics technicians (two), tool mechanics (two) and process mechanics (two).

All apprentices come from the district of Schwandorf: Tobias Braun and Thomas Büchel from Schwarzach, Stefan Brickl and Florian Rewitzer from Schmidgaden, Johannes Beer from Neunburg vorm Wald, Felix Domaier from Oberviechtach, Daniel Sorgenfrei and Sebastian Zahner from Pfreimd and Ferdinand Strebl from Teunz.
The new trainees previously visited Haupt- or Mittelschulen and Realschulen.

From Wednesday to Friday, the trainees of all ages as well as the trainers will go to a team-building event in Oberammergau, where, among other things, a full-day hike and rafting on the Inn are on the agenda.
The company has 435 employees throughout Germany and 950 employees worldwide.
The number of trainees spread over all years is 27.
The Socialists in France should "keep their mouths shut and put France in order," said the most important ally of Francois Hollande.
Mr Valls called on the deeply divided left to show "their love" for the controversial socialist president, whose cabinet conversion has been met with disapproval by the large majority of the French.
The President deserves everyone's respect, he deserves our loyalty, he deserves our support.
"It is our duty to stay by his side," he said with great applause.

As a appeasing gesture, the Prime Minister insisted that his government would not call into question the controversial 35-hour week in France, despite strong demands for a relaxation of Emmanuel Macron's regulation, the new Minister for Economic Affairs.
On Saturday, Mr Hollande had urged his fellow socialists to show themselves "united" with the government.

But Christiane Taubira, the Minister of Justice, threw sand into the drive in which she appeared at a meeting of apostate socialist MPs and criticized the Socialist Party for taking the French "the faith in their future".

Marine Le Pen, the far-right leader of the National Front, mocked the Socialists' constant trench struggles and said that she could not imagine that the new Valls government would last longer than a few months.
Francois Hollande is the emperor without clothes, but Prince Manuel Valls has none either, they are forced to form a new government if the old has not even survived a summer.
"And the new one will also not survive the fall or winter," said Miss Le Pen to supporters.
She repeated her party's call for a dissolution of parliament and said that she was confident that she would be the victor in early elections and that she was ready for the government.
The ruling party of France suffered a defeat in the local elections in March and the right-wing National Front was ahead of the EU elections in May.

A survey in the Sunday newspaper Journal du Dimanche revealed that 76 percent of French people believe that the Socialist Party is at risk of falling into several rival factions before the end of Holland's term in 2017.

Pascal Perrineau, a political scientist at Sciences Po University, warned that the French would quickly lose patience if the new socialist government did not achieve an improvement in the economy and record unemployment figures.
"There is a small window for possibilities, but public opinion must feel quickly that things are changing," he warned.
Otherwise, the situation could deteriorate further.
Norwegian Cruise just before a deal with Prestige Cruises of $3 billion

Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd NCHL.O, the world's third-largest cruise provider, leads, according to industry experts, advanced negotiations to acquire the competitor Prestige Cruises International Inc for about $3 billion.

A deal would give Norwegian Cruise, a company with a market value of $6.8 billion, access to the luxury cruise ships of Prestige Cruises as well as to its wealthy customers, while competing with larger rivals such as Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd (RCL.N) and Carnival Corp (CCL.N).
An agreement could already be announced this week, the sources said on Sunday and warned that the talks could also end without results.
The owner of Prestige Cruises, the private equity company Apollo Global Management LLC (APO.N) also owns a 20% stake in Norwegian Cruise.
The sources asked to remain anonymous, as the negotiations were not public.
Representatives of Norwegian Cruise and Prestige Cruises did not respond to requests for comments, while a spokesman for Apollo rejected a comment.
The Miami-based company Norwegian Cruise operates 13 cruise ships on routes between North America, the Mediterranean, the Baltic Sea, Central America and the Caribbean.
Its revenues amounted to $2.57 billion in 2013, an increase of 13 percent compared to 2012.

Prestige Cruises, also located in Miami, operates under the brand names of Oceania and Regent, which together operate eight cruise ships on routes to Scandinavia, Russia, the Mediterranean, North America, Asia, Africa and South America.
It reported revenue for 2013 of $1.2 billion, an increase of 6 percent compared to the previous year.
The cruise industry totals around $29 billion and is expected to grow in the coming years due to the strengthening of the middle class in emerging markets such as China and India.
The companies are trying to position themselves as the best choice among cruise providers for these new customers.
Prestige Cruises applied to the US regulatory authorities for the IPO in January 2014.
Apollo is the majority shareholder in the company since a $850 million deal in 2007.

Norwegian Cruise, in its current form in 2000, was formed by a merger with a cruise provider owned by Genting Bhd (GENT.KL), a leisure and casino conglomerate under the control of Malaysian billionaire Lim Kok Thay.
Apollo invested $1 billion in Norwegian Cruise in 2008.
Norwegian Cruise went public in January 2013.

According to regulatory authorities, Genting held 28 percent of the shares, Apollo 20 percent of the shares and the private equity company TPG Capital LP an 8 percent stake in the company at the end of June.

Carnival, Royal Caribbean Cruises and Norwegian Cruise together have 82 percent of the passenger capacity of American cruise ships, according to the original application documents for the IPO of Prestige Cruises.
Pro-Hong Kong activists condemn China the day after the election decision.
A peking faithful group waved the Chinese flag nearby.
On Sunday, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress passed a framework law allowing only two or three candidates to vote for leadership in Hong Kong in 2017.
All candidates must first obtain the majority support of a nomination committee, which is expected to be filled with peking-faithful members.

This decision makes it almost impossible for opposition democrats to be allowed to vote and prompted pro-democracy activists to uphold their threat and paralyze Hong Kong's financial centre with "Occupy Central" protests.
Political reforms have long been a controversial issue in Hong Kong, and China's leadership fears that calls for democracy will expand to other cities.

Following the publication of a Beijing White Paper, which presented China's predominance over Hong Kong in June, democracy activists held an unofficial referendum on the electoral process in the Special Administrative Region, where hundreds of thousands marched to the city's business district and organised a sit-in.
Li's interview is organized by the government in Hong Kong and the Chinese liaison office in Hong Kong.

Mr. Zhang Rongshun, Deputy Chairman of the Legal Commission of the Standing Committee, and Mr. Feng Wei, Deputy Director of the Hong Kong and Macaus Office of the State Council, were to be questioned during the day.
Student activists announced that they would gather in front of the leadership office in Hong Kong in the afternoon.
Britain did not foresee any democratic elements until the final phase of the 150-year-old colonial government in Hong Kong.
Putin calls on Kiev to open "state talks" with eastern Ukraine

Russian President Vladimir Putin demanded Russian media reports on Sunday that the Ukrainian government stop fighting the separatists in the east of the country and immediately start negotiations on the "state" of the apostate region.

His spokesman Dimitri Peskov later made it clear that Putin did not mean that the territory of eastern Ukraine under the control of the separatists would become part of Russia, but that his status with Ukraine had to be redefined in order to give the Russian-speaking region the power to represent its rights and interests.

Putin's appeal to the Kiev government to negotiate on an equal footing with the pro-Russian insurgents, however, fits in with the strategy he seems to have pursued since the start of the riots five months ago: helping separatists to take over territories and pressure on the Ukrainian government to allow the newly proclaimed Novorossija region to effectively independence for an alliance with Russia rather than with the West.

In an interview with the State TV channel Channel One, Putin condemned the Ukrainian military campaign to reconquer separatist-held areas in the eastern regions of Donetsk and Luhansk, which were taken in March and April after Moscow annexed the Ukrainian Crimean peninsula on March 18.
The Kremlin and the separatists have recently called the occupied territory "Novorossija" or "Neurussia", a term reminiscent of the pre-revolutionary splendor of the Russian empire.

Putin pointed out that all those who, in the course of the campaigns of Ukrainian politicians for the elections on 26 Oct. and while government groups are attacking civilian communities in the separatist areas, are hoping for early peace talks "captured in their illusions," reported Itar-Tass.

"We must immediately engage in detailed discussions, not only on technical issues, but also on the political organisation of society and the state status of south-eastern Ukraine, in order to safeguard the interests of the people living there," he said.

Peskov said that Putin's reference to statehood must be seen in the context of greater autonomy, which has been discussed for months by the Kiev leadership in order to dispel fears in Russian-speaking areas that their cultural and linguistic rights are at risk.
Only the Ukrainian government can give the eastern regions the necessary autonomy, Peskov said.
This is not about negotiations between Ukraine and Russia, Peskov said, "because it is not about a conflict between Russia and Ukraine, but about an internal conflict in Ukraine."

The clarification of the Kremlin spokesman on the correction of Putin's "misinterpretation" underscored Russia's claim to leadership in dealing with the separatist rebellion in the East, as opposed to the direct annexation of Crimea, where the majority of the 2 million inhabitants are ethnic Russians.

Moscow would have far greater difficulties in annexing the Donetsk and Luhansk regions in eastern Ukraine, as most of the 6.5 million inhabitants are not Russians and polls from the pre-conflict period resulted in a large majority for staying in Ukraine.

The autonomy raised by Russian diplomats on international forums would give the regional governments in Ukraine the power to negotiate their own trade agreements and external relations, giving the Kremlin de facto control over an area connecting the Russian territory with Crimea.
The Black Sea peninsula annexed five months ago is the home port for most of the Russian navy, as well as an important commercial port and historic coastal region.
The regions between the Rostov region in Russia and Crimea are also rich in mines, factories and foundries that produce important components for the Russian military.

Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko, in his speech at the inauguration on 7 June, proposed that Ukraine's legislation, after new elections, should consider additions to the Constitution to give the respective territories greater control over their finances and the status of languages.
But his idea of autonomy seems to be in sharp contrast to those of the Kremlin and the separatist rebels, whose armament and incitement Moscow is accused of.

Putin's last call to Kiev to negotiate with the separatist leaders at eye level followed after a further advance of the rebels last week, after Russian troops and tanks invaded eastern Ukraine via the previously peaceful region along the Azov Sea.

The Russian-backed separatists took control of Novoazovsk in handshake, which, according to fears of Ukrainian security officials, is the first step in a campaign to take over the strategic coastal region to Crimea.

For this reason, massive civilian and military preparations have begun to secure Mariupol, a steel port with 500,000 inhabitants, located between Novoazovsk and narrow access to the Crimean peninsula.

Poroshenko spoke at a meeting of the EU leadership in Brussels on Saturday and urged action to prevent further Russian aggression against Ukraine, a former Soviet republic that has been independent for 23 years.
"We are close to a point where there is no turning back," warned Poroshenko.
Thousands of foreign troops and hundreds of foreign tanks are now on the territory of Ukraine.

The EU summit did not decide on any concrete actions, the leadership demanded the draft further sanctions against Russia, which should enter into force in the event of an unspecified escalation of the Ukraine crisis.

Ukrainian soldiers had to withdraw from their positions in Ilovajsk after two Russian armored columns and 1,000 soldiers invaded the Donetsk region last week to support the besieged separatists, said Colonel Andriy Lysenko, spokesman of the Ukrainian National Security and Defence Council reports on Saturday in Kiev.

The first presumably 63 Ukrainian soldiers trapped by the Russian invasion of Ilovajsk were exchanged on Sunday for 10 Russian paratroopers captured on Ukrainian territory a week ago, Lysenko reported on Sunday.
Nude photo scandal around Australian celebrities and Gabi Grecko
Geoffrey Edelsten didn't hide his anger about hackers who probably stole nude pictures of his fiancée Gabi Grecko and a who's who of the A-promis from Hollywood.
The film city is in excitement after a series of clear photos of a naked Jennifer Lawrence appeared in a hacking scandal around celebrities on the Internet.

The responsible hacker probably has 60 nude photos of Lawrence, star from "The Tribute of Panem" and superstars, among them the models Kate Upton and Cara Delevingne, the singers Rihanna, Ariana Grande and Lea Michelle as well as the actress Kirsten Dunst.
Australian actresses Teresa Palmer, Emily Browning, Yvonne Strahovski, and Grecko from Melbourne reportedly also published private photos due to an iCloud gap.
There are 101 celebrities on the list.
Noblest, who had been engaged to Grecko last month, said to Confidential, "It's disgusting."
All private letters and pictures should remain private.
It is a shame that private information can be stolen and passed on to others.
Grecko, currently in New York, reportedly told a news website that the hack was "harmful" and that the people affected felt "harmed."
The hacker probably has 30 pictures of Palmer with her ex-boyfriend Scott Speedman, among them two shots in which she lies upstairs without in a pool.
Palmer's film works include "Liebe ist invincible" with Liam Hemsworth.
Palmer, Chuck-Star Strahovski and the actress Browning from Sucker Punch were not available yesterday for comments on the hacked pictures.
A representative of Lawrence told TMZ, "It's a heinous violation of privacy."
Actor Seth Rogen condemned the hacker in his tweet: "Posting hacked images from a cell phone is nothing else than selling hehlerware."
From a purely legal point of view, the distribution of stolen images should not be tolerated.
Cyclists, joggers and hikers were present yesterday at the 8th cycling on the Große Feldberg and supported the association "Help for children with cancer".
The tour, which was an ordeal for some, was an easy training for the others.
In one, however, everyone agreed: it was fun.
Thomas Studanski must have slept well last night.
For the first time in his life, the head of the Oberursel brewhouse drove yesterday by bike to the Feldberg.
For the good cause.

He can easily put away the little muscle ache, especially since the participation in the 8th cycling on the Große Feldberg in favour of the association "Help for children with cancer" (Frankfurt) also brought him a valuable insight personally.
That's a great thing.
"I know I can do that now - great!"
Little chat on the way in the applause curve?
No, if I had stopped once, it would have been over...

Like Thomas Studanski, who sits in the Oberursel City Parliament for the CDU, many of the 718 participants tortured themselves yesterday in the early thaw and came close to exhaustion, but happy on the plateau.
Others, on the other hand, found it easier to overcome the well - eleven - kilometre - long route between Hohemark and Feldberg.
Norman Dießner, for example.

The green politician from the Kreistag - red dress, red bike - made a little bit of understatement at the start ("Every lot of professionals, there is arrival the goal!"), but then turned out to be half a professional on the mountain and went through the finish after 45 minutes without breathlessness.
He, too, went through the track in one slide, as well as Nina Kuhn, press officer of the city of Oberursel, who had set out together with Frank Grüneisen.
For the two triathletes, the "Feldberg-Radeln" was not necessarily a sporting challenge: "This is about charity, we would like to be there - we would have made an exit today anyway", says Kuhn.
On the way they had met Paul Wenzel from Oberreifenberg.
The boy (12) had gone down to Oberursel in the morning to walk up the hill again.
The Frankfurter Florian Zierz had swung into the saddle at 9 a.m. at home, "making" the Feldberg twice, and then rolling home with fun.
It was fun, too, "Friten-Toni."
For the head of the Oberurseler Kultkiosk cycling tours over the Feldberg are simply included.
He had targeted 40 minutes with his 6.5 kilo racing bike.
It's a crazy event.
For this purpose - I am happy to be there," said Andreas Balzke.
The trained Mainzer says of himself that he is a "ambitious racing cyclist".
That's what he has to be, because he was on the road with the "Fixie bike", which are also racing bikes, but without circuit...

Not only did the 20 hikers, who climbed over the White Wall and the Fox Dance to the summit, prove that it was easy to climb up without a bike, but also a jogger, who pulled a car tire with weights on a cord.

Bergwacht-doctor Professor Volker Lischke, who provided safety with his team, equipped with four-wheel-bully and quad, said: "I know that" from Frankfurt, who trains for a special sled trail, only that he pulls the sled himself." So the man is his own sled dog.
The 718 participants - and thus as many as never before - had been sent to groups in the morning.
The walkers first at 9:30.
The first cyclists and runners followed at 10 a.m.
Five minutes later, the first mountain bikers started.
Bent Hansen, chairman of the association "Radeln auf den Großen Feldberg", gave the starting squads and wished the participants a nice trip.
For next year he hopes that he will be able to block the route to Feldberg up to the safety of the participants.
en_cs: Petr Čech: Transfer na poslední chvíli?
Všechno je možné.
Dnes je poslední den, kdy je stále možné skočit přes přenosové okno a udělat zásadní změnu.
Další šance nepřijde dřív než v zimě.
Petr Čech je v současné době náhradním brankářem pro Chelsea, ale nyní nečeká na novou profesionální smlouvu v Madridu, Monaku ani Paříži.
Sedí v hotelu NH v Praze, hovoří s českými reportéry a plánuje se s českým týmem zúčastnit zkušebního zápasu s Američany, po kterém také zahájí proces kvalifikace pro Euro 2016 proti Nizozemsku.
Chelsea dá v nové sezóně Premier League v cíli Thibaut Courtois přednost a Čech poprvé za deset let v londýnském týmu skončil v pozici náhražky.
Před časem se spekulovalo, že Real Madrid by mohl mít zájem o Čechy.
Na začátku sezóny prohrál španělský Super Cup v soutěži s Athletics a ani se mu nepodařilo vstoupit do ligy, když prohrál 2:4 v San Sebastian.
Zájem Paris SG byl také spekulován.
Začala sezóna Francouzské ligy dvěma vítězstvími a dvěma tahy a v neděli porazila St. Etienne 5:0.
Vyvíjí největší tlak na A.S. Monako.
Zatím má rovnováhu 1-1-2 v lize, a o víkendu se rozešla s Lille s 1:1 kravatou.
Dnes se zprávy objevily na bulvárních anglických webových stránkách, kde se uvádí, že Queens Park Rangers mohou chtít Čechy.
Podle anglických bookmakerů však odjezd Čechů z Chelsea na poslední chvíli není příliš pravděpodobný.
Skybet mu přidělil kurz 4:1.
Petře, je možné, že během posledních pár hodin si vyměníte uniformu?
Nepředpokládám to, ale ve fotbale není nikdy nic 100%.
Například během dne může přijít nabídka, která nemůže být odmítnuta.
Jak by taková nabídka vypadala?
"No, ještě nevím, jak ta nabídka, která nemůže být odmítnuta, v podstatě vypadá.
U všech stran by musel existovat konsensus a hlavně by závisel na postoji Chelsea ohledně toho, zda nabídku přezkoumat či nikoli.
Je vůbec možné provést takový převod, když jste teď v Praze?
Nebylo by nutné, abyste podepsal novou smlouvu někde na novém místě?
O tom jsem neuvažoval.
Ale v takové situaci, existuje mnoho hráčů dnes, a všechny z nich jsou někde v zastoupení zápasů, a určitě dnes mnoho převodů bude dokončena.
Takže by to mohlo být dosažitelné.
Kolik je na světě klubů, které si tě můžou dovolit?
No, já opravdu nevím.
A netlačíte na odchod?
Situace, kdy jsem neskončil nikde jako brankář v prvních třech hrách nové sezóny je nová pro mou patnáctiletou kariéru.
Nicméně není třeba panikařit, sbalit se a někam jít.
Chci zůstat v soutěži o pozici brankáře Chelsea, a je to na trenérovi, který bude vybrán a jaké rozhodnutí udělá v příštích týdnech.
Jakou roli ve vašich rozhodnutích sehrála vaše rodina?
Beru v úvahu všechny faktory.
Sportovní vyhlídky jsou pro mě pochopitelně důležité, ale také se na všechno dívám z osobního hlediska, což samozřejmě zahrnuje ohleduplnost k potřebám rodiny.
Je možné, že byste mohl hrát jako brankář pro jiný tým v Anglii?
To je otázka, o kterou bych se nikdy nestaral.
Ale ve fotbale je všechno možné.
Nechci nic vyloučit.
Neznám odpověď.
Indie a japonští premiéri se scházejí v Tokiu

Nový indický premiér Narendra Modi se setkává s japonským protějškem Šinzo Abe v Tokiu, aby prodiskutoval ekonomické a bezpečnostní vazby na jeho první významné zahraniční návštěvě od doby, kdy vyhrál Mayovy volby.
Pan Modi je na pětidenní cestě do Japonska, aby posílil hospodářské vazby se třetí největší ekonomikou na světě.
Nejvyšší na pořadu jednání jsou plány na větší jadernou spolupráci.
Indie údajně také doufá v dohodu o obranné spolupráci mezi oběma národy.
Karratha policejní zatčení 20-rok-starý po vysoké rychlosti motocyklu Chase
Motocykl byl zabaven poté, co byl sjel 125 km/h v 70 km/h zóny a přes Bushland uniknout policii v Pilbara.
Dopravní policie na hlídku v Karratině se dnes ráno pokusila zastavit modrou motorku, když si všimli, že dosahuje 125 km/h, když vyjela z čerpací stanice na Bathgate Road.
Policie říká, že jezdec se pak nezastavil a pokračoval na Burgess Road, než se změnil v Bushland, což důstojníky přimět, aby ji ztratili ze zřetele.
Motorka a osoba odpovídající popisu jezdce byl pak spatřen v domě na Walcott Way v Bulgarra.
Policie Karratha obvinila 20letého muže, že nezastavil a bezohledně řídil.
Dne 23. září se má objevit v Karratha Magistrátes Court.
Motorku zabavili a zabavili na tři měsíce.
George Webster obviněn z znásilnění hotelů Nairna a Pitlochryho
Muž má být obviněn ze znásilnění žen ve dvou hotelech.
George Webster, 28, čelil obviněním během slyšení u Nejvyššího soudu v Glasgow.
Údajně dne 7. června 2013 znásilnil ženu ve skotském hotelu v Pitlochry v Perthshire.
Tvrdí se, že ji Webster napadl, když byla "nevědomá, spala a nemohla dát souhlas."
Webster je pak obviněn ze znásilnění druhé ženy v hotelu Golf View v Nairnu na Vysočině 4. května 2014.
Soudkyně Lady Rae stanovila datum soudu na 17. listopadu u Nejvyššího soudu v Edinburghu.
Spojení s velmi americkým ideálem, že pracovní práva jsou lidská práva
Kongresman Keith Ellison a John Lewis navrhli právní předpisy na ochranu organizace odborů jako občanského práva.
"As go unions, so go middle-class jobs," říká Ellison, Minnesota demokrat, který slouží jako kongresový Progressive Caucus spolupředsedou.
Proto jsem hrdý na to, že vám představuji zákon o posílení pracovních sil s ikonou o občanských právech Johnem Lewisem.
Tato průlomová legislativa poskytne pracovníkům stejné právní možnosti pro organizaci diskriminace jako pro jiné formy diskriminace - zastavení protiunijních sil v jejich stopách

Změna Národního zákona o vztazích mezi pracovními silami, která umožní pracovníkům, kteří čelí diskriminaci za účast na organizaci odborů, žalovat o spravedlnost u občanských soudů - a sbírat vyrovnávací a odškodné škody -, je zdravou a nezbytnou iniciativou.
Ale rozhodně to není radikální iniciativa - alespoň podle amerických standardů.
Nejlepší způsob, jak pochopit, co Ellison, Lewis a spolupachatelé jejich právních předpisů navrhují, je opět spojit se s velmi americkou myšlenkou.

Navzdory týrání, které v posledních letech podnikly odbory - ve Wisconsinu, Michiganu a státech po celé zemi - Američané kdysi povzbuzovali země po celém světě, aby přijaly, rozšířily a respektovaly práva na pracovní sílu.
Byly doby, v živé paměti milionů Američanů, kdy tato země prosazovala demokracii, svobodu slova, svobodu tisku a právo organizovat ve stejném dechu.

Když Spojené státy obsadily Japonsko po druhé světové válce, generál Douglas MacArthur a jeho pomocníci povzbudili zemi, aby přijala ústavu, která má zajistit, že militarizovaná autokracie Hidekiho Toja bude nahrazena demokracií.

Plně si uvědomili, že pracovníci a jejich odbory mají hrát roli při formování nového Japonska, včetně jazyka, který výslovně uznal, že "právo pracovníků organizovat a vyjednávat a jednat kolektivně je zaručeno."

Když Spojené státy obsadily Německo po druhé světové válce, generál Dwight David Eisenhower a jeho pomocníci vyzvali Němce, aby napsali ústavu, která by zajistila, že fašismus Adolfa Hitlera byl nahrazen svalovou demokracií.

Němci si uvědomovali, že pracovníci budou muset organizovat a činit hlasy, které budou slyšet v novém národě, a proto v něm bylo výslovně uvedeno: "V každé osobě a každé okupaci nebo povolání bude zaručeno právo vytvářet sdružení na ochranu a zlepšování pracovních a ekonomických podmínek.
Dohody, které omezují nebo usilují o narušení tohoto práva, jsou neplatné; opatření směřující k tomuto účelu jsou protiprávní.

Když bývalá první dáma Eleanor Rooseveltová předsedala Mezinárodní komisi pro lidská práva, která vypracovala Všeobecnou deklaraci lidských práv, kterou by v roce 1948 přijala Organizace spojených národů jako globální smlouvu, Roosevelt a návrháři zahrnuli záruku, že "každý má právo tvořit a připojit se k odborům na ochranu svých zájmů."
Po generace Američané přijali základní předpoklad, že pracovní práva jsou lidská práva.

Když tato země radila jiným zemím, jak zfalšovat občanské a demokratické společnosti, Američané vysvětlili, že právo organizovat odborovou unii - a mít tuto odborovou unii v kolektivním vyjednávání jako rovnocenného partnera s korporacemi a vládními agenturami - musí být chráněno.

Nyní, když jsou tato práva v Americe napadena, je opravdu moudré znovu se vyjádřit k americkému ideálu, že pracující lidé musí mít právo organizovat a přimět své hlasy slyšet ve svobodné a otevřené společnosti.
Jak před padesáti lety řekl reverend Martin Luther King Jr.:
Historie je skvělá učitelka.
Nyní každý ví, že pracovní hnutí nezmenšilo sílu národa, ale rozšířilo jej.
Zvyšováním životní úrovně milionů lidí práce zázračně vytvořila trh pro průmysl a zvedla celý národ, aby nesnil o úrovni produkce.
Ti, kteří útočí na práci, zapomínají na tyto jednoduché pravdy, ale historie si je pamatuje.
Historie si to pamatuje, stejně jako my.
Formální uznání práv na pracovní sílu jako lidských práv - a rozšíření ochrany občanských práv, aby se zabránilo diskriminaci v oblasti organizace práce - je již dávno pozdě.
Keith Ellison a John Lewis obnovují ideály, které historicky rozšířily Ameriku a učinily skutečný příslib demokracie.
Soudce dočasně blokuje zákon, který by mohl uzavřít všechny kliniky pro potraty v Louisianě.
Americký federální soudce v neděli dočasně zablokoval vymáhání Louisianského zákona, podle kterého by bylo pravděpodobně uzavřeno všech pět potratových klinik ve státě.

Opatření, které v červnu podepsal guvernér Louisiany Bobby Jindal a které mělo nabýt účinnosti 1. září, by vyžadovalo, aby lékaři, kteří provádějí potraty, měli pacienty, kteří přiznávají práva v nemocnici v okruhu 30 mil od své praxe.
Soudcovo rozhodnutí však znamená, že lékaři mohou v současné době pokračovat v provádění legálních potratů při hledání takových výsad.
"Plaintiffs budou moci fungovat legálně a zároveň pokračovat ve svém úsilí o získání privilegií," napsal v rozhodnutí federální soudce John deGravelles.
Slyšení bude naplánováno do jednoho měsíce, aby soudce rozhodl trvaleji.
Aktivisté za práva potratů tleskali rozhodnutí, poslední v řadě rozhodnutí proti podobným opatřením, které by doktorům poskytlo více času, aby hledali nemocniční privilegia.

"Dnešní rozhodnutí zajišťuje, že ženy v Louisianě jsou v bezpečí před nepodřízeným zákonem, který se je snaží zbavit jejich zdraví a práv," uvedla Nancy Northupová, prezidentka a vedoucí ředitelka Centra pro reprodukční práva, která žalovala o zablokování zákona jménem tří z pěti klinik státu.
Nebylo okamžitě jasné, zda se rozhodnutí vztahovalo na lékaře ze dvou klinik, kteří nebyli žalobci v žalobě a požádali také o přiznání výsad.
Louisiana je jedním z jedenácti států, které schválily podobné zákony, přičemž soudy nedávno vládly protiústavním opatřením v Alabamě a Mississippi.
Klíčové části texaského zákona, které by zavřely většinu zbývajících klinik v tomto státě, byly v pátek blokovány federálním soudcem.
Tvůrci práv na potrat spolu s Americkou akademií porodníků a gynekologů a Americkou lékařskou asociací říkají, že přiznání privilegií ukládá lékařům lékařsky zbytečné požadavky.
Zastánci boje proti potratům se stavěli proti tomu, že opatření mají chránit zdraví žen, i když někteří také chválili jejich účinek na uzavřené kliniky.
Pouze jeden lékař, který provádí potraty v Louisianě, má v nemocnici výsady přijímané, řekl Centrum pro reprodukční práva.
Pokud budou všichni ostatní lékaři ve státě nuceni přestat provádět potraty, lékař, který se bojí o svou bezpečnost, přestane provádět zákrok, řekla skupina.
V argumentaci proti rozhodnutí Louisiana úředníci řekli, že nebudou trestat lékaře provádět potraty, zatímco jejich žádosti o přiznání výsady byly čekány.
Zpožděná diagnóza a neschopnost přístupu k nejlepší léčbě znamená, že rakovina vaječníků zabíjí více ve venkovských oblastech
Angelina Jolie a její bratr James zveřejnili poctu své zesnulé matce, která zemřela na rakovinu ovarií v roce 2007.
Ženy žijící ve venkovské Austrálii jsou vystaveny vyššímu riziku úmrtí na rakovinu vaječníků než jejich městské protějšky.
Výzkumníci analyzovali lékařské záznamy více než 1100 australských žen diagnostikovaných v roce 2005 s rakovinou vaječníků, které zjistily, že pět let po diagnóze žilo jen 35 procent lidí.

Vedoucí výzkumná pracovnice Susan Jordanová z Ústavu pro lékařský výzkum QIMR Berghoferová uvedla, že osoby žijící v regionálních a odlehlých oblastech státu jsou během studie o 20 procent pravděpodobnější, že zemřou.
MALÉ STUDIE: Nové léky mohou zpomalit rakovinu plic, vaječníků
Výzkumníci sledovali ženské lékařské cesty během sedmi let.
Doktor Jordan řekl, že věk ženy v době diagnózy, typ rakoviny vaječníků, mají již existující nemoci a sociálně-ekonomický stav také vliv na šance na přežití.
Starší ženy a ty, jejichž rakovina byla v době diagnózy pokročilejší, měly nejnižší míru přežití.
Ti, kteří žili v regionálních a odlehlých oblastech státu, byli asi o 20% pravděpodobnější, že během studie zemřou, než ti v městských oblastech.

Přestože studie nebyla navržena tak, aby určila, proč ženy žijící mimo město byly pravděpodobnější, že zemře na rakovinu vaječníků, Dr. Jordan navrhl opožděnou diagnózu a neschopnost přístupu k nejlepší léčbě mohou být faktory.
"Tato nemoc je nejlépe léčena gynekologickými onkology a jsou většinou založeny ve velkých městech," řekla.

Navzdory zlepšení telemedicínských služeb, aby se snížila tyranie vzdálenosti, navrhla více fly-in, fly-out služby, aby specialisté mohli zacházet se ženami blíž k domovu a programy na podporu lidí v léčbě daleko od jejich komunit by mohly pomoci.
Doktor Jordan řekl, že bez ohledu na zeměpisné postavení, studie zjistila dlouhodobé přežití u žen s rakovinou vaječníků byla špatná, což posílilo potřebu lepší léčby a preventivní strategie.
Výzkum, který financuje Rio Tinto Ride to Conquer cancer, bude dnes zveřejněn v časopise Medical Journal of Australia.
V březnu 2012 bylo ve věku 33 let mamce z Gold Coast Elišovi Neaveovi řečeno, že má agresivní formu rakoviny vaječníků.
Zahradní centra rue padá u majitelů domů

Pokles, spolu s konkrétním poklesem počtu majitelů domů ve věku do 35 let, by mohl vést k tomu, že zahradní centra ztratí desítky milionů liber ročně, když dnešní mladí spotřebitelé dosáhnou "staré zahradnické skupiny," podle studie HTA, kterou ohlásily Financial Times.
Podle zprávy lidé, kteří si pronajímají nemovitosti, utratí v průměru 55 procent z částky, kterou ti, kdo mají vlastní domovy, utratí za své zahrady.

Citovala nárůst lidí žijících ve vysoce urbanizovaných oblastech bez zahrad, popularitu dlažby na předních zahradách pro parkování a zmenšení velikosti zahrady jako další faktory ohrožující průmysl, který má hodnotu odhadem 5 miliard liber prodeje každý rok.
Větší Londýn, kde se domácí vlastnictví za posledních šest let snížilo z 61 procent na 43 procent, má nejnižší výdaje Británie na zahradnické výrobky.
HTA a Royal Horticulture Society řekl, že pronájem nemovitostí nebo nedostatek zahradního prostoru neznamená, že lidé nemohou pěstovat rostliny.
Guy Barter, hlavní zahradnický poradce RHS, řekl: "Kontejnerové zahradničení, například, je obzvláště populární u nájemců, kteří mohou přesunout své rostliny, když se přestěhují."

Zpráva HTA označila období mezi lety 1997 a 2005 jako "zlatý věk" zahradního maloobchodu v důsledku zvýšeného vlastnictví domů a hospodářské prosperity od konce 80. let do poloviny 90. let 20. století.
V letošním roce také předpověděla zlepšení trhu kvůli lepšímu počasí v důsledku nepříznivých podmínek v březnu a dubnu loňského roku.
Když východní diktátor káže o demokracii.

Na setkání jeho mládežnické organizace, které se musí podobat Hitler Youth, chřestli jeho sabers tím, že poukázal na to, že Rusko má jaderné zbraně a v podstatě všem dal jasně najevo, že se nezajímá o jejich názory, dnes nám dal přednášku o demokracii.
Mám však pocit, že současný režim v Rusku má mnoho vlastností fašistického státu.
Velké země mají jednu věc společnou, a to je to, že obě mohou využít vášnivého nacionalismu a přeměnit komplex méněcennosti v imperialistické choutky.
Čas na východě zřejmě ubíhá jinak než na Západě.
Zatímco západní svět věří, že éra válek a dominance nad Evropou skončila, na východě si myslí naopak, že již příliš dlouho byly přehlédnuty a že je nezbytné znovu získat své mezinárodní postavení.

Takové nálady a frustrace převládaly v Německu ve třicátých letech minulého století, krátce před tím, než nacisté převzali moc, a po ní následovala erupce nacionalismu, která se nepodobala dnešní situaci v Rusku.
Absolutně identický kult mocného vůdce, bití novinářů, likvidace politických oponentů a diskriminace gayů a dalších menšin jsou velmi blízko tomuto myšlení.
Vladimír Putin a jistě mnoho Rusů zřejmě postrádá dobu, kdy Rusko vládlo polovině světa a druhá polovina se ho obávala.

Západní politici to museli způsobit sami, možná tím, že Vladimira dostatečně nepoplácali po ramenou, možná tím, že ho nepozvali na místo, kam chtěl jít, a možná tím, že ho začali podceňovat, po kterém se choval jako typický ruský silný muž.
Udělal si doma pořádek, choval se, jako by nechtěl nikam jít, a doma si brousil nože.
Nyní se rozhodl, že chce získat zpět ztracenou pozici své země.
Začne postupně, protože má čas.
Pravděpodobně bude vůdcem na celý život, tak proč spěchat?
Šlápl na Kavkaz, teď šlápne na Ukrajinu, a trpaslíci z Baltského moře jsou pravděpodobně další na řadě.
Už dlouho jsou trnem v oku ruského medvěda.
To si jistě všimne i Čína, která dělá hodně vln a sleduje Dálný východ.
A také Němci opravdu rozčilují Vladimira tím, jak se jim daří, a my jsme jim v roce 1945 nakopali zadky.
Co takhle založit Novorossiyu v Karlových Varech?
Mohla by to být malá základna a je tam spousta krajanů a jsou tam tak utlačovaní a někteří místní už chtěli zbourat některé své domy.
Koneckonců, naši veteráni si stále pamatují, jak dobře to měli v Československu.
A jejich premiér, Gospodin Sobotka, je tak měkký, že může být oloupán jako cibule, a s ním i celá jejich EU.
Takhle by to dopadlo, aby se skvělé Rusko mohlo znovu vzkřísit.
Musíme jim připomenout, kde bydlí.
A můžeme použít naše krajany, kteří žijí na jejich území jako zbraně.
Všude je spousta Rusů, a když se řekne, že jsou utlačováni, pak jsou jednoduše utlačováni a my je takhle neopustíme, ale my je ochráníme.
A pak budou mít Rusové opět kontrolu, protože pro co se potom ještě narodili?
Koneckonců, Evropa je pouze odrazovým můstkem, na který může hrdý Ivan udělat Kozácký tanec.
Turecko předvolává americký diplomat přes špionážní zprávu
Turecké ministerstvo zahraničí svolalo nejseniornějšího amerického diplomata v zemi, aby objasnilo zprávu o americkém a britském špionáži v Turecku.
Vicepremiér Bulent řekl, že americké obvinění d'affaires a turečtí úředníci diskutovali o zprávě v pondělí.

Německý časopis Der Spiegel a online časopis The Intercept uvedl, že dokumenty poskytnuté bývalým analytikem americké národní bezpečnostní agentury Edwardem Snowdenem ukazují, že Turecko je pro americké a britské zpravodajské služby vysoce prioritním cílem.
Podle tureckých zpráv turecký prezident Recep Tayyip Erdogan snížil význam zprávy a řekl, že všechny hlavní země se navzájem špehovaly.
Dřívější zpráva, že se německá hlavní zpravodajská agentura zaměřila také na Ankaru, nakreslila ještě rozzlobenější reakci turecké vlády.
Sériová "Hra o trůny" představuje více triků ve čtvrté sérii
Tvůrci "Hry o trůny jsou v současné době natáčení epizody páté série ikonické seriálu.
Zatím se mohou chlubit tím, jak byly vytvořeny triky čtvrté série.
Nejviditelnějšími rysy jsou počítačové modifikace prostředí seriálu a masové scény, kdy obří armáda Daenerys vyjde z davu vojáků.
Šéf policie Magaluf obžalován z korupce.
Žalobci předložili v pátek doklad o vydírání policistů a státních úředníků Calvià Town Hall v kanceláři státního zástupce Mallorcy.
Vedoucí policie Calvià na rekreačním ostrově Mallorca byl zatčen poté, co obchodníci a majitelé baru podali obvinění z korupce na známém místě popíjení v Magalufu.
Vrchní inspektor José Antonio Navarro byl ve vazbě poté, co proti němu vznesli obvinění z korupce několik podnikatelů z Punta Ballena, ulice, kde se nachází většina Magalufových barů a nočních klubů.
Podle online deníku Mallorca Diario žalobci v pátek předložili důkaz o vydírání policistů a státních úředníků Calvià Town Hall v kanceláři protikorupčního prokurátora Mallorcy.
Dva další místní policisté byli zatčeni španělskými civilními gardami v souvislosti s tvrzením o korupci a budou muset být vyslýcháni soudcem po boku Navarra.
Španělský národní deník ABC uvedl, že nespokojení majitelé nočních klubů tvrdí, že favoritismus ze strany úřadů má vážný vliv na jejich podnikání.
"Není to o vydělávání peněz, je to o přežití," řekl jeden z podnikatelů soudu.
Nezahrávej si s naším živobytím.
Nemáme co ztratit.
Magaluf letos v létě natočil mezinárodní titulky v důsledku virálního videa na YouTube, které během hospůdky předvedlo 18letého britského rekreanta, který předváděl felace na 24 mužích.
Ostrovní úřady se od té doby pokusily umlčet opilecké a nepořádné chování Magalufových revolverů minimalizací čísel na notoricky proslulých barových plazích.
Kromě toho byl klub Playhouse, kde došlo k incidentu s felacemi, nucen na rok zavřít, zatímco pořadatelé Playhouse a baru Carnage společně pokutovali 55 000 eur (73 000 dolarů).

Turistické letovisko Magaluf, oblíbené především u mladých britských rekreantů, také zažilo četné alkoholové nehody zahrnující šílenství známé jako "balkon," kde lidé skáčou z jednoho balkonu na druhý nebo z balkónu do hotelového bazénu.
První den jara označený vlhkými a blusterickými podmínkami ovlivňujícími lety letiště Adelaide
SPRING má wintry překvapení na jižní Jižní Austrálii, přináší těžké sprchy a silné větry, které ovlivnily lety na letišti Adelaide.
Dalších 5mm deště padlo na město večer až do 9pm, po 6,6mm, který padl přes noc v neděli.
Nejnovější déšť přišel s laskavým svolením několika krátkých, blustery sprchy, včetně výbuchu, který začal těsně před osmou odpoledne, který odhodil téměř 4mm za 10 minut.
Po zimě minulý týden doručila časná dávka jara, teploty se opět v pondělí snížily na pouhých 15,8C ve městě.
Předpokládá se, že squally podmínky přispěly k opožděnému přistání letu Virgin Airlines z Melbourne do Adelaide.
Letadlo mělo přistát těsně po 19:30, ale bylo zasaženo větrným šípem - náhlou změnou rychlosti větru nebo směru na krátkou vzdálenost - a bylo nuceno vytáhnout.
Poryvy větru v té době dosáhly asi 50 km/h na zemi na letišti Adelaide.
Letová data ukazují, že letadlo muselo vystoupit z druhého přistání a letadlo se nakonec srazilo asi o 20:40.
Zpoždění letu způsobilo pozdější zpoždění několika dalších letů, včetně letu Emirates z Dubaje a letu Qantas ze Sydney.
Top 16C je předpověď pro Adelaide v úterý, s možností sprchy nebo dvou.
Izraelské děti se po válce v Gaze vracejí do školy

Tisíce izraelských dětí v oblastech poblíž pásma Gazy se vrátily do školy v pondělí poté, co strávily léto v úkrytech proti bombám, když během 50denní války mezi Izraelem a Hamašem na jejich společenství pršely rakety a minomety, zatímco školy v Gaze zůstaly zavřené, když se území zotavilo z boje.
Začátek školy přinesl pocit radosti a vzrušení raketově zjizvených komunit v jižním Izraeli, ale známky bojů zůstaly čerstvé.
V jižním městě Ashdod, zaměstnanci ve školce "Pashosh," která byla zasažena raketou, odstraněny šrapnely značky ze zdí a skluzavky před příchodem studentů.
"Máme trochu strach, ale jsme nadšení," řekl Ronit Bart, obyvatel Kibbutz Saad a učitel angličtiny ve své škole.
Spousta dětí v naší oblasti se musí vrátit k rutině.
Její jedenáctiletá dcera Shani Bartová řekla, že se najednou vrátila do školy.
"Bylo to těžké období a vůbec jsme neopustili naše domy," řekla.
Prezident Reuven Rivlin navštívil kibutz, který se nachází blízko hranice Gazy, aby nabídl svou podporu.

Dokud minulý týden nezastavilo válku příměří, tisíce obyvatel pohraničních komunit jako Saad zůstali uvnitř nebo opustili své domovy pro bezpečnější oblasti dále od Gazy, aby unikli raketě a minometné palbě.
Mnoho obyvatel Nahal Oz, komunity blízko hranice Gazy, kde byl čtyřletý chlapec zabit palestinskou minometnou mušlí, váhají s návratem zpět.
Ministerstvo školství řeklo, že asi tucet rodin se ještě nevrátilo.
Jejich děti byly v současné době umístěny do alternativních škol.
Premiér Benjamin Netanjahu navštívil školu v Sderotu, hraničním městě Gazy, které bylo těžce zasaženo palestinským ohněm.
Naléhal na děti, aby tvrdě studovaly a řekl: "Ujistíme se, že vám poskytneme znalosti a zajistíme vám bezpečí."
Izrael a Hamás se minulý úterý dohodly na otevřeném příměří.
