The Minsk summit talks did not resolve the problems for which they had been convened but created a new format: the first European Union personalities met with the first faces of the future of Eurasians.
For the first time, EU and Customs Union leaders have discussed a number of "hot issues" for concern (the situation around Ukraine cannot be postponed).
Whether such a structure is capable of working effectively is not clear; it is clear who removed the cream from this summit.
Questions in this regard were dismissed on the evening of 26 August, when Belarusians and other Eurasians with Europeans saw the new President Lukashenko on television.
The Belarusian leader set an example of refined courtesy, which was the behavior of the man who just ripped off the jackpot - and planned a worthy old age in the highest society.
How Maydan Lukashenko helped

The arrival in Minsk of the three main European Commissioners (EU Ministers), who met with Lukashenko and allowed him to speak at the final briefing on their behalf, is not just the legitimization of the President with 20 years ' experience.
This is an application for the recognition of Minsk as a full subject of European policy and as the main mediator of the Ukrainian crisis.
The Senior Analyst of the Belarusian Institute of Strategic Research, Denis Melyantsov, is confident that Brussels will no longer be able to speak to Minsk in the same tone as before.
"The fact that Katherine Ashton met his aunt-a-tet with Lukashenko suggests that relations with the EU will continue to defrost," he said, "Fire."
This iceberg has a hidden part: preparations for a breakthrough by Belarusian authorities began well before Maydan in Kiev in the summer of 2013.

"The results have been achieved and with the EU - successful negotiations on visa facilitation and readmission, dialogue on modernization - listed the interviewer Fire, - and international security talks have been held with the US.
The States even lifted a few sanctions.
With regard to the Ukrainian events, they themselves and the reaction of the Belarusian leadership only encouraged the process.
Minsk, on the one hand, was able to maintain relations with Ukraine - warm enough to not lose much in mutual trade, and President Poroshenko could come to Belarus for negotiations.

On the other hand, the Belarusian leader, who de jure did not recognize Crimea's accession to Russia and called for the punishment of pro-Russian militias in Donbass with the utmost seriousness, did not fight with Moscow.
Minsk has neither withdrawn from the Customs Union nor from CSTO, and there is a Russian airbase in Baranovich.
Brussels and Washington noted Minsk ' s balanced position on the Ukrainian issue - and appreciated it, the Belarusian experts are sure.
The success of the Lukashenko movement towards political diversification will be seen in how often Minsk will be able to host EU+TC meetings in the near future.

At the Press Service of the EU High Representative for Foreign Policy and Diplomacy, Catherine Ashton was unable to respond quickly to questions about what Brussels expected from the relationship in a new format.
Press secretary Ashton Maya Kosyančić simply stated that, while war and peace issues were being addressed, the topic was not a priority.
At the same time, it was reported that Kazakhstan could be the next venue for a meeting on the Ukrainian issue, with the participation of the first persons in the new format.
A drop of degta for Minsk was the statement by President Nursultan Nazarbaev, in which he admitted that he had been personally asked by the representatives of the European Union to do so.

At the final briefing, however, Alexander Lukashenko made it clear that all parties were not opposed to Minsk remaining the central venue for meetings, both in Russia-OSCE-Ukraine and at the level of heads of State and high-level representatives of the European Commission.
This means that Europe's "last dictator" is gaining the status of a handshake European leader who is helping to solve a global problem.
European farmer's best friend

The very composition of the EU delegation, which included the Euro-commissions on trade and energy, led to the conclusion that the main thrust of the summit was not the tragic situation in Donbas, but the economy.

Indeed, the timetable established at the meeting for future negotiations on gas supply and for overcoming the concerns of TC countries under the Ukraine-EU association agreement seems to be more ambitious than peace declarations without specific dates and numbers.
The Commissioner for Trade, Carl De Gucht, however, pointed out that EU representatives "have come to Minsk to seek a solution to a political crisis that has economic consequences, not vice versa".
It seems, however, that the economic crisis in Ukraine is working for Belarus.
Its consequences - especially the reciprocal sanctions of the West and Russia - give Minsk, which is still under sanctions pressure, a long-awaited space for manoeuvre.

According to the head of the Mieses Research Centre, former presidential candidate Jaroslav Romanchuk of Belarus, European investors are actively interested in the capacity of Belarus to supply agricultural products in the Russian Federation to circumvent sanctions.
In doing so, supply schemes are being put forward, for which Vladimir Putin at the summit pissed Minsk off.
"These schemes are initiated by Russian companies rather than by Belarusian businessmen," he pointed out.
They have worked on long-term supply chains, including from Poland, Germany and Lithuania, and these schemes are now destroyed.
Russia's business is in dire need of something to restore it, even through the mediation of Belarusian structures.

The second story, the expert continues, relates to the fact that many Ukrainian companies are willing to start production in Belarus from Ukrainian raw materials also with a focus on the Russian market.
Ukrainian producers have about $4 billion in exports to Russia, and Belarusian production and trade schemes can now be very much needed."
In the view of Romanchuk, the role of host of the EU negotiating forum and TC is ideal for Lukashenko and for the development of economic ties with Europe.

He recalled that the losses of the EU agricultural sector from Moscow sanctions were estimated at Euro5-10 billion, and the European Commission had now offered only Euro125 million in compensation to farmers.
The Belarusian president can ask Brussels to work together to minimize the consequences for Euro-farmers.
This could raise the profile of Lukashenko in the EU to unprecedented heights.
Hospitality without initiative
Catherine Ashton thanked the Belarusian authorities for the initiative to hold the summit.

But the paradox is that the official Minsk from its active role in the birth of the TC+EU format is being removed, and the Belarusian leader at a meeting with a Ukrainian colleague stressed that the new format was indeed Kiev.

"It was your offer to meet, without any delay, to discuss, not from the bay, to decide, after the signing of the EU Association Treaty, to understand the situation that was at that time developing in Ukraine," he addressed the cameras to Peter Poroshenko.
However, the observers interpreted this as an attempt to calm Moscow, and it was rumored that it was initially opposed to the mediation of Minsk, which greatly increased its political weight.

Belarus ' diplomatic agency has been working hard to emphasize that Belarus, in organizing EU-TC interaction on its land, has no selfish goals, and the ultimate goal of such a format is to create a single economic space from Lisbon to Vladivostok in the future.

"It is absolutely in the spirit of the concepts that in other spheres, particularly in the field of security, promote and promote the leadership of our strategic ally, the Russian Federation," said "Flame" in the Ministry of Belarus, an agency where words have been carefully chosen recently.

The French socialists must "shut up and get France in order," says Frasois Holland's key ally.
Mr. Wall called on the deeply divided left-wing forces "to demonstrate a warm attitude" towards the attacked Socialist President, whose reshufflings were not approved by the vast majority of French.
The President deserves everyone's respect, he deserves our loyalty, he deserves our support.
"It's our duty to stay close to him," he said, with applause.

As a gesture of reconciliation, the Prime Minister assured that his Government would not question the controversial 35-hour working week in France, despite proposals fuelling the conflict, it should weaken the rules made by Emmanuel Macron, the new Minister of Economy, earlier this week.
On Saturday, Mr. Holland begged his Socialist Party comrades to remain "one" with the government.

However, Christian Tobier, Minister of Justice, put the sticks in the wheel, coming to a meeting of dissenting members of Parliament from the Socialist Party and criticizing the Socialist Party for allowing the French to "lost faith in the future".

Marín Le Pe, the leader of the far-right National Front, expressed contempt for the constant internal conflicts among the socialists, saying that she did not realize that the new Wall government would last longer than a few months.
François Holland is a naked king, but the naked and Prince Manuel Wall, forced to gather a new government when the previous summer did not last.
"And the new one won't last autumn or winter," said Mrs. Le Pen's reporters.
She reiterated her party ' s call for the dissolution of Parliament, saying that she was confident that the party could easily win early elections and was ready to run.
The ruling French party was defeated in the March municipal elections, and the far-right National Front came first in the EU elections in May.

A survey of Sunday's magazine du Dimanche found that 76 percent of the French believed that the Socialist Party was at risk of breaking up into several rival factions before the end of Mr. Holland's presidential term in 2017.

Pascal Perryno, a political scientist at Cyance Poe University, warned that the French would quickly lose patience if the new socialist government failed to correct the economy and record unemployment.
"He doesn't have much time, but public opinion needs to feel fast that something's changing," he warned.
Otherwise, the situation could get worse.
"City without Drugs" was left without a lawsuit.
The Sverdlov Court of Arbitration dismissed the claim of the Managing Directorate of the Regional Ministry of State Administration against the "City without Drugs" Foundation.
The Office intended to recover more than 7 million roubles from the organization as rent for a building in the centre of Yekaterinburg.
However, the plaintiff did not appear in court twice.

Today, the Arbitral Tribunal of Sverdlovsk Region has left pending the action of the Executive Directorate of the Ministry of Public Property Management of the Region (MIGISO) against the "City without Drugs" Foundation (co-founder, Mayor of Yekaterinburg, Evgeny Royzman).
The representatives of the regional authorities intended to collect 7.3 million roubles from the organization as rent for the building.
It was now known that the plaintiff had failed to appear twice, which had led to the decision not to proceed.
The reason for the absence of representatives from the MUGISO Directorate could not be explained; Maxim Titov, Head of Legal Affairs, did not answer the phone.
The Fund ' s representatives were also unable to be contacted.
Again, this is a mansion that occupied a foundation in the centre of the city on Belinsky Street, 19 free of charge since 2011.
This decision was made by the former Governor, Alexander Misharin.

In November 2012, the Managing Directorate of the Ministry of Public Property Management of Sverdlov Region filed an action with the Sverdlovsk Court of Arbitration for the eviction of the foundation from the building.
According to the claim, the agency requested the court to declare the unconstructed free-of-charge contract to be the premises of the memorial mansion.
According to the MUGISO Directorate, the agreement did not include substantial conditions for the lease of a cultural heritage site.
The Sverdlovsk arbitral tribunal dismissed the claim and then appealed to the 17th arbitral tribunal, Permi, which was granted.

The Foundation then filed a cassation appeal against the decision with the same court, which was rejected, after which the decision was appealed by the Foundation to the High Court of Arbitration, but the Court accepted the Director ' s motion.
In 2013, a new lease agreement was concluded under which the foundation began to pay rent again, as reported by the head of the city of Evgeny Royzman.
Rent was set at 300,000 roubles per month.
The previous district administration gave us this building free of charge, recognizing our merit in the fight against drugs, as a sign of respect for the foundation.
The current administration had decided differently," he said.
Tatiana Drogaeva, Yekaterinburg
Why the mayor of Yekaterinburg was asked to leave voluntarily

iPhone will be turned into a wallet.
In the run-up to 9 September, when Apple is supposed to present his new designs, there are more leaks in the press about what can be expected from the presentation.

With reference to American media sources, the sixth generation of iPhone will be equipped with a mobile wallet function as a result of the joint Apple and Visa, MasterCard and American Express payment systems.

According to Bloomberg and Re/code's dedicated Internet resource, Apple can also announce a joint project with Visa, MasterCard and American Express on 9 September, making the mobile wallet function available in the new iPhone 6 smartphone.
The companies themselves refuse to comment on this matter.
This function allows payments to be made on the store ' s register using a smartphone.
The identification of the payment will be performed by the user using his thumbprint using the Touch ID function.

It is reported that this is the first time that NFC (near field communication) will be introduced in the iPhone, which allows a non-interactionable payment to be made by means of a smartphone and an appropriate reader on the cash register.
The NFC technology itself will be available through a special microprocessor from the Dutch high-tech company NXP (formerly Philips Symiconducors).

The NFC function was first introduced in 2004 as part of the collaboration of Sony, Nokia, Philips Semiconducors and more than a hundred other companies that joined the so-called NFC Forum, an association to promote this technology.
The first NFC phone was released by Nokia in 2006.
The first smartphone on Android with a NFC function, Samsung Nexus S, was introduced in 2010.
In May 2011, Google introduced Google Wallet, which allows users to link their bank cards to their Google account and pay with an Android smartphone.

American experts stress, however, that despite major investments by high-tech companies in the advancement of NFC technology, American Riteilers are still cautious about innovation and are not too willing to spend money on the equipment of their stores with such systems.
Therefore, observers now hope that Apple ' s entry into this market will still make the rangers speed up and accelerate the deployment of this technology in their outlets.

Norwegian Cruise is approaching a $3 billion deal with Prestige Cruises

Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd NCHL.O, the third largest cruise operator in the world, is in the final stages of negotiations to purchase a similar company, Prestige Cruises International Inc. for approximately $3 billion, according to people familiar with the situation.

The deal would provide Norwegian Cruise, a company with a market value of $6.8 billion, with access to Lux-class cruise ships and secured clients of Prestige Cruises, as it competes with the larger rivals of Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd (RCL.N) and Carnival Corp (CCL.N).
An agreement could be announced this week, and sources reported on Sunday, warning that negotiations could still fail.
Prestige Cruises, a private investment company, Apollo Global Management LLC (APO.N), also owns 20 per cent of Norwegian Cruise shares.
Sources have asked to remain unnamed because the negotiations are not open.
Norwegian Cruise and Prestige Cruises did not respond to requests for comments, while Apollo refused to comment on the information.
Norwegian Cruise, based in Miami, runs 13 cruise ships on routes covering North America, the Mediterranean, the Baltic Sea, Central America and the Caribbean.
Its income was $2.57 billion in 2013, 13 per cent higher than in 2012.

Prestige Cruises, also based in Miami, works under Oceania and Regent brands, which together own eight cruise ships that go to Scandinavia, Russia, the Mediterranean, North America, Asia, Africa and South America.
She announced an income of $1.2 billion in 2013, 6 per cent higher than the year before.
The $29 billion cruise industry is expected to benefit from middle-class growth in emerging economies such as China and India in the coming years.
The race companies seek to position themselves as cruise operators preferred by these new customers.
Prestige Cruises was registered with U.S. regulators for the first public share in January 2014.
Apollo became the main shareholder of the company after a $850 million deal in 2007.

==History==Nrwegian Cruise was created as it now exists in 2000 as a result of a merger with a cruise operator owned by Genting Bhd (GENT.KL), a conglomerate of entertainment and a casino under the control of Malaysian billionaire Lim Kok Thea.
Apollo invested $1 billion in Norwegian Cruise in 2008.
Norwegian Cruise became a public company in January 2013.
Genting owned 28 per cent, Apollo owned 20 per cent, and a private investment company, TPG Capital LP, owned 8 per cent of the company's shares, as of the end of June, according to reports.

Carnival, Royal Caribbean Cruises and Norwegian Cruise together account for 82 per cent of cruise traffic in North America, according to the registration documents for the first public distribution of Prestige Cruises shares.

Hong Kong Democratic Movement activists disrupt the Chinese representative ' s statement the day after the election decision
A group of citizens loyal to Beijing stood nearby, waving the Chinese flag.

The Standing Committee of the National People ' s Congress on Sunday determined a procedure whereby only two or three candidates would be allowed to participate in the election of Hong Kong ' s leader in 2017.
All candidates should first receive the support of a majority of the members of the nomination committee, who would probably be full of Beijing loyalists.

The decision makes it almost impossible for the democratic opposition to get on the ballot and forced the democratic movement to promise again to stop Hong Kong's financial center with Occupy Central protests.
Political reform is the main source of tension in Hong Kong, as Chinese party leaders fear that the call for democracy will spread to other cities.

Following Beijing ' s publication of a document describing China ' s control over Hong Kong in June, democratic activists held an informal referendum on elections in the special administrative region, and hundreds of thousands went to the city ' s business centre and held a sit-in.
The briefing is organized by the Government of Hong Kong and the Chinese Liaison Office in Hong Kong.

The Vice-Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People ' s Congress, Jang Rongshun, and the Deputy Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Bureau of the State Council, Feng Wei, were also scheduled to address a series of briefings during the day.

Putin demands that Kiev begin negotiations on "Stateship" of eastern Ukraine

According to Russian news reports on his comments, Russian President Vladimir Putin demanded on Sunday that the Ukrainian government cease fighting with separatists in the east of the country and immediately begin negotiations on the "State" of the separated region.

His press secretary, Dmitry Peskov, later clarified that Putin did not mean to imply that eastern Ukrainian territory under separatist control would become part of Russia, but that its status within Ukraine needed to be reviewed to enable the Russian-speaking region to defend its rights and interests.

However, Putin's call for the Kiev government to start negotiations with the pro-Russian rebels as being equally consistent with the obvious strategy that he has followed since the beginning of the bloodshed five months ago: to help the separatists take the territory and compel the Ukrainian government to give the newly proclaimed territory of Novorossia de facto independence in order to get closer to Russia rather than to the West.

In an interview with State First Television, Putin condemned the Ukrainian military campaign for the return of separatist-held territory in eastern Donetsk and Luhansk regions, which was seized in March and April after Moscow annexed the Ukrainian peninsula to Crimea on 18 March.
The Kremlin and separatists have recently named the seized territories of Novorossia, or New Russia, a name that refers to pre-revolutionary days of Russian glory.

Putin said that anyone who believed that peace talks would take place in the near future, when Ukrainian politicians began campaigns for parliamentary elections on 26 October, and while government forces were attacking peaceful settlements in separatist-held regions, the "plenary of illusions", reported ITAR-TASS.

"We must immediately begin meaningful negotiations, not only on technical issues, but also on the political structure of society and the state status of south-eastern Ukraine, in order to meet the interests of the people living there," he said.

Peskov said Putin's words about statehood were in the context of broader autonomy, which had been discussed for months with leaders in Kiev in an attempt to calm fears in Russian-speaking areas that their cultural and linguistic rights were in danger.
Only the Ukrainian government can give the eastern regions the necessary autonomy, Peskov said.
This is not a matter for discussion between Ukraine and Russia, said Peskov, "because it is not a conflict between Russia and Ukraine but an internal Ukrainian conflict".

The intervention of the Kremlin Press Secretary to correct Putin's "misinterpretation" highlighted the decision of the Russian leadership to behave towards the separatist rebellion in the east in a different way than the open capture of Crimea, where the majority of the 2 million people are ethnic Russians.

Moscow would have to endure a much harder battle to join even the Donetsk and Luhansk regions of eastern Ukraine, as most of the 6.5 million inhabitants were not Russians, and the polls before the conflict showed broad support for the desire to remain inside Ukraine.

The autonomy that Russian diplomats discussed in international forums would give regional governments in Ukraine the power to determine trade agreements and foreign policy themselves, essentially by transferring to the Kremlin de facto control of territory that would connect Russia ' s main territory with Crimea.
The Black Sea peninsula, attached five months ago, has the main Russian military fleet, as well as commercial maritime institutions and historic sea resorts.
In the regions between Russia ' s Rostov region and Crimea there are also mines, factories and foundries that produce the necessary equipment for the Russian army.

Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko proposed, during his inaugural speech on 7 June, that Ukrainian legislators, after the new elections, weigh constitutional amendments that would give separate regions greater control over their finances and language status.
However, his view of autonomy seems to differ greatly from that of the Kremlin and the separatist rebels accused of arming and inciting Moscow.

Putin ' s latest appeal to Kiev to negotiate with separatist leaders as equals followed new rebel attacks last week after Russian troops and tanks entered eastern Ukraine from a previously peaceful area along the Azov Sea.

The Russian-backed separatists took control of the town of Novoazovsk in an offensive against which Ukrainian security officials say they fear it is the beginning of a campaign to seize strategic coastal territory up to Crimea.
This entailed extensive civilian and military efforts to strengthen Mariupol, a steel port with 500,000 inhabitants, located between Novoazovsky and the narrow passage to the Crimean peninsula.

Poroshenko addressed the European Union Leaders' Assembly in Brussels on Saturday to call for measures to prevent further Russian aggression against Ukraine, the former Soviet Republic, which had been independent for 23 years.
"We're approaching the point of no return," Poroshenko warned.
Thousands of foreign military personnel and hundreds of foreign tanks are now inside Ukraine.
The EU summit did not take certain measures; the leaders called for the drafting of more severe sanctions against Russia to be adopted in the event of any escalation of the Ukrainian crisis.

Ukrainian soldiers had to withdraw from their positions in Ilowaysk after two columns of Russian armoured equipment and 1,000 military personnel had entered the Donetsk region last week to support the troubled separatists, Colonel Andry Liesenko, the spokesperson of the National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine informed reporters in Kiev on Saturday.

The first of the 63 Ukrainian soldiers reportedly detained in Ilowaysk as a result of the Russian invasion were exchanged on Sunday for 10 Russian airlifters captured in Ukrainian territory a week ago, who reported to Lysenko on Sunday.

Mass hacking of star accounts may have been done through vulnerability in the Find My Phone application.
A potential scenario described the Next Web resource.
A Python script was published on Github, which enabled the search of the passwords for the Apple's "Find My Phone" service.
This service allows you to track the location of the iPhone.
The same line of logic and Apple ID password is used for access to the Apple iCloud cloud from which photos of celebrities were stolen.
The script allowed the Find My Phone password to be cross-checked.
The method consistently introduces all kinds of symbol combinations, starting with the most commonly used passwords.

If the security system is correctly organized after several unsuccessful attempts to enter the wrong password, the account must be blocked and inform the user of the attempted break-in.

The SCR stopped investigating the To 204 accident in Vnukovo.
The Russian Investigation Committee (SRC) has discontinued the criminal investigation into the crash of the T-204 aircraft Red Wings.
The agency's press service reports it.
The decision was made in connection with the death of the aircraft commander and the aircraft engineer.

Forensics have shown that the crash was caused by the increased speed of landing, the failure of the crew to comply with standard boarding procedures, and the unintended release of the engines to the higher speed of direct propulsion.
The To 204 aircraft of Red Wings, which was flying from Prague to Moscow, crashed on 29 December 2012 at the Moscow airport of Vnukovo.
The aircraft rolled out behind the runway and caught fire.
An aircraft commander, a second pilot and a pilot were killed at the scene.
Two flight attendants were taken to treatment facilities, where they subsequently died of injuries.
Three other flight attendants who were hospitalized with serious injuries were given long-term treatment.
In addition, the driver of the vehicle travelling on the Kiev highway at the time of the crash sustained serious injuries.
There were no passengers on board the aircraft.
The Transport Prosecutor ' s Office conducted an inspection at Red Wings in the aftermath of the disaster, during which numerous irregularities were identified.
In February 2013, the airline ' s licence was suspended.
The company resumed operations in the summer of 2013.

Anger turned out to be the most universal and functional human emotion.

The angry expression of a person is biologically universal for mankind, and every organ and group of muscles involved in its creation is not random, but an additional means of expressing power and threat, learned by scientists from Australia and the United States.
They reported on their findings in the magazine Evolution and Human Behavior, and they can be read briefly in a press release from the University of California in Santa Barbara.

The angry expression of faces - moved and down the eyebrows, drawn lips in the thin line, puffed nostrils - is the same in all cultures, and even blind children who have never seen it are making it, as noted by Aaron Sell, the lead author of the study.
As part of a major research project on the nature of anger, scientists have learned that this emotion has emerged to deal effectively with disputes during the conflict.
The more physical damage one person can cause to another, the more he can dictate his conditions, and he communicates it with anger.

Researchers have also found evidence of their own hypothesis: physically strong people are more likely to be angry and to resort to manual use, feel free to impose conditions upon others that do not benefit them, and prefer to use force to resolve conflicts peacefully.

In response to the fact that anger is first and foremost an "emotion of trade", scientists have decided that the movements of each of the seven muscle groups, which create an angry face, should present the angry individual with a stronger and more dangerous face - and thus force him/her to accept his/her terms as soon as possible in order to avoid conflict.
To test this hypothesis, researchers modelled on the computer the faces where each of the seven elements of the angry face was present or missing and showed them to informers.
Although the downed eyebrows or the forward chin alone did not make the face angry, the more physically powerful person in the study was unanimously recognized.
The anger of man, like that of animals, poses a threat: an exaggerated act of self - strength that compels consent and submission.
A man blows up nostrils and presses his lips for the same purpose as a frog who blows up, or a grandmother who shows his fangs.
"The anger "begins" the respondent's refusal to accept the situation, and the person immediately takes a form that shows the opposite side as effectively as possible the consequences of the refusal.
But the most striking thing is that none of the components of the angry face is arbitrary, all of them expressing the same thing," noted Anthropologist John Toubi.
The Ministry of Communications has proposed 250 million rubles for the Crimea television and radio company.
The Ministry of Communications proposed to allocate 250 million roubles from the federal budget in 2014 to the Autonomous Non-Profit Organization Crimea Teleradio.
This is referred to in the draft Government Regulation prepared by the agency, which was reviewed by Lenta.ru.

According to the explanatory note to the project, grants from the federal budget will be allocated "to cover the costs of creating conditions for extensive information coverage of the socio-economic situation and the development of a modern information space in the territory of the Republic of Crimea, including the acquisition of equipment".
In particular, it is envisaged that the hardware and studio unit, the video walls, the central hardware and the video server will be converted with the money allocated.
The acquisition of a mobile television station and a satellite transmitter is also planned.
In addition, the company will pay for the use of the fibre-optic line (WALS) and the repair of the energy system from the funds allocated.
Grants will be provided within the federal budget allocated to the Ministry of Communications.
The State Broadcasting Company Crimea was established in 1959 and broadcasts in seven languages: Ukrainian, Russian, Crimean Tatar, German, Greek, Bulgarian and Armenian.
Today, over 75 per cent of the area of the peninsula is covered by television broadcasting.
In 2011, the Crimea Teleradio Company was licensed to broadcast digital television.
